abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Some lessons of
            experience suggest the following. The Bank is better
            positioned if involved from the outset in an emergency
            response situation, for it allows rapid financing, in this
            case, from the National Environment Project, and transfer
            funds for emergency and preparatory work. Thus, fire
            prevention activities actually started even before the loan
            agreement was signed. It is reinforced that for emergency
            operations, project design needs to be flexible, in light of
            changing circumstances, and, supervision should be intensive
            due to the fast preparation, and implementation. Notably, in
            an emergency, inaction may be politically or psychologically
            unacceptable. Once large-scale fires occur, the costs of
            stopping them are prohibitive. In many cases, it may be
            impossible to contain fires in remote areas, and even then,
            the government must act, not only to avoid the spread of
            fire to other sensitive areas such as protected areas and
            indigenous lands, but to give the general public a sense of
            safety and security. Emergency projects must be followed by
            a long-term strategy to prevent future emergencies, and,
            decentralization and partnerships are essential on the field.
